item.title: China blasts: Insurance costs top $1.5 billion
item.description: A deadly series of explosions that left hundreds dead and injured in China is about to set off a wave of insurance claims.
item.ExtractedText: China blasts: Insurance costs could top $1.5 billion by Sophia Yan @sophia_yan August 18, 2015: 3:41 AM ET A series of explosions that left hundreds dead and injured in China is about to set off a wave of insurance claims. While the full impact remains to be seen, initial insurance claims could reach $1.5 billion, according to an estimate by Credit Suisse. It's been about a week since the explosions rocked the northeastern coastal city of Tianjin , killing at least 114 people -- with many more bodies likely trapped in the rubble. At least 57 people are still missing, according to authorities. About 90,000 people live within a 5-kilometer radius of the blast site, the China Earthquake Networks Center said. Chinese insurers across numerous sectors -- property, casualty and life -- will be impacted by the blasts, Credit Suisse analysts wrote in a research note. "Many international insurers will [also] be impacted as they either insure multinationals directly or provide reinsurance coverage to the Chinese insurers."
